E6TLG8GL5zVanf2Z6yLV4g.text: Excellent value and very good flat iron steak in the Camden section of London near the Phoenix Theater.  Only meat offered in this cozy restaurant is the flat iron steak which was nicely seasoned and surprisingly good.  We choose sides of  and creamed spinach which were both very nice. The wine was also very good.  The steak comes with a small salad.  The service was friendly and spot on. We highly recommend this restaurant.

BZLh1g89Zvm0jy3wygRJ4Q.text: A very simple and focussed menu. Good quality food, reasonably priced and excellent service. The service is efficient and good recommendations too. A friendly atmosphere and un-rushed.

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom. Burps
Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom

NFFiMzTU3_ZD0qsTCL8Zuw.text: Food was delicious, the meat was tender, service was on point. Will definitely come back!

VnDzDQovCxpB5aVKPFfrUg.text: Awesome steak,  great service,  the fries were godly,  and I had a dope ipa. Would recommend.

zAB3tT3f9ZeZv_GNLWx24w.text: Great value for money. Just above 10 pounds for the standard meat dish. Quite tasty, but the aubergine side was to die for. Best thing in the restaurant!

cDcc3izvo8_RpCy_RZt4Ng.text: Lovely place and a great evening!!! Definitely worth every minute we had to wait for our table. The steaks were just delicious, as well as the rest of the food and drinks we tried. Super friendly staff and nice atmosphere, we really enjoyed the time there.Highly recommended and a must-do if in London!!

XtjnAkYwILHaeTA9NZCH8g.text: OMG best steak ever.. Good service excellent price... my boyfriend actually ate 2 steaks ...sauce to die for... Desert very tasty... Best food in london

-gN5wEKJ5mxkEZLKR0xCeQ.text: I'd been wanting to try Flat Iron for ages but always worried about the wait for a table. Thankfully, at this location at least, we only had to wait 10 mins on a weekday night.  We had the steak, fries, bearnaise sauce, creamed spinach, and roast aubergine (not something I'd usually choose but so glad we did), all of which were to die for and perfect sized portions  (we split the two sides among the 3 of us).  We also ordered the sundae to share, which was delicious but quite a bit smaller than we'd anticipated!  Staff very friendly and helpful too.  Will absolutely be making many return visits.

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom. Steak, bearnaise, fries, baked aubergine, creamed spinach, and Strawberry & Basil Collins.

tpq-zSuWY0-kmRGmlSXUow.text: I came here with a big group and had a decent meal. Most of us had the steak, a couple had the special, which was a burger. I was very happy with the steak, it was tender and juicy. I was told the burger was good too, also, the fries were tasty. The green salad that comes with the steak was ok, the tin cup they serve it in was a bit weird. Desert was also very nice.Overall, this was a great meal, the service was good and staff were friendly.

IXxwnc5Nwgfj2gJ7Xf91Jw.text: Very decent steak at a very decent price. Perfect for a quick lunch. In the midst of yard-long menus and endless choice of sandwiches at the Prets of this world, I found the "We have only have steak, and we only have one steak. If you don't want that steak you're screwed" menu relaxing and sortof fun even. Cool staff. Quick service. Persistent quality. I keep coming back.

vK_6tcPoriEGqZgKa0WJQg.text: I think they should focus on their main product a little more - Steak. I ordered mine medium rare and was given a steak that was tasteless and prepared at a medium temp. I thought the steamed broccoli, Bernaise sauce and salad were better then the actual steak. I ordered a lime and mint fizz that took as long as our dinner to be delivered to our table -- I had to ask about it 3 times. Felt that the staff focused on being "cool" rather than actually focusing on customers. Major room for improvement there. Lastly, I think walking in and being flung an iPad by a grumpy hostess, and then waiting 45 mins to be sat is disappointing when the meal wasn't good. Was really hoping for a better meal after reading all these 5 Star reviews that I'm now suspicious of. I had a 2 star experience at best.

q9auHFeiTEPMRuQvmiXqXA.text: A bit hard to review flat iron as I kind of feel they are actually trying to be a cheap restaurant for tourists to feel they have been a bit Zeitgeist without having to pay the earth ...They have a fantastic grill that cooks the meat well ...You get a steak and a green salad for a tenner ... Plus service.They have on trend beers and cocktails ...They are looking in the right direction with sides and dessert.The green salad that comes with the steak isn't worth eating ...But this place is supposed to make tourists feel like they have been to a cool London place ... And on that note it is cooler than Byron ... But the food is worse but more fashionable ...What did you want from your tourist trap?But I really didn't enjoy the wood taste of fresh (not frozen peas) ... The creamed spinach was well made with a hint of nutmeg and mature not baby spinach.

ZqMYke7qmOjHDzqGNkVPQg.text: We stopped here after taking my grandson to the guitar shops on Denmark St. REALLY good quality flat iron and wagyu steaks at good prices (£10 flat iron; £18 wagyu). Comes with small green salad. All other sides are extra. Great service

ra93d98I17_lofMy6oS1vA.text: Simple menu - just flat iron steak! And for the princely sum of £10. Choices of sauces and sides. The creamed spinach is fantastic - don't miss this one. The chips unique - doubled fried. No reservations so do come early

hSjsSaCpTBRqpMmVhq85yA.text: Great spot to stop before the theater! The strawberry and basil Collins cocktail is delicious. Slightly sweet with a kick of vodka in it. The flat iron steak is very tender and a good deal for only 10 pounds. The fries (chips) are a must and the steak comes with a small salad to cover your greens. The wait staff was also very friendly!

wlrqYqkD_zqb1rypyjP1pg.text: Found this gem on Yelp during my first visit to London and was thoroughly impressed. They do not take reservations so we arrived around 9 and put in our name and phone number after being told we would be seated in around an hour. We came back around 10 and were seated shortly after. The staff was extremely friendly and explained their concept thoroughly. The food:-First of all, the strawberry basil soda is just divine.-The complimentary popcorn was a fun appetizer-The salad that came along with the steak was a nice refreshing touch -The flat iron steak (although not he larger piece of meat I've seen) is ultra tender, and cooked and seasoned to perfection. It is pre cut, but they do provide a charming miniature cleaver for your slicing needs. -The peppercorn sauce is tasty and although the bowl of it looks small, I probably could have shared it with someone else. -The Aubergine (eggplant) side was super tasty and baked nicely. -The creamed spinach was probably the only disappointment as it was nothing special and a bit bland. Overall, we left super duper satisfied by this hipster joint and will be back during my future visits to London.

UYXRS1ogJQ9rS2ZEO1AgXw.text: When we first saw the skimpy menu I was worried.  But what they lack in options they make up for in quality and flavor.  Every thing we had was cooked perfectly and so flavorful.  I'd recommend a cocktail as the options were creative and each one was fabulous.  We watched the bar tender shaving the ice by hand from a huge block.  This was definitely our favorite dinner during our London visit.  We wanted to go back again but didn't have the time.  One more reason to return to London...

yRiMJo4CsRtjSu3WxotiHQ.text: Incredible value for the money, steaks are just amazing at £10. The Béarnaise sauce was among the best I've ever had, and the dessert was great. On top of that service was superb. Nice environment and an overall very good experience!If I could give one word of advice to the owners it would be to work on the wine temp. Red wine should not be served at room temperature when it's 25 degrees inside.If you don't wanna eat steak stay away. It's the only thing they've got on the menu :)

EVZnCKCF5x4_Ag-9-pQXkg.text: Wow. If you want a decent steak for a good price in central, this is your place. My partner and I ordered the flat iron and the two specials - wagu and brisket and the flat iron was best by far (and the cheapest) cocktails were cheap but small and tasty. Only reason this isn't getting a 5 is the aubergine side was hard and inedible but they took it off the bill. Enjoy!

qvykMFvnCpJ5QOt92NPrBw.text: Absolutely love it here - great steaks, good service and very good value for money.  Slightly prefer this one to the original Beak St branch.

AigumVHyk8kXqfneYiDdXA.text: WHAT DELICIOUS STEAK! And...how inexpensive! Low key lunch spot, great for a reliably delicious piece of meat, with all the right accompaniments!

4SleIxYZ-DUR1vbWeweRmg.text: Got food poisoning after yesterday lunch there...steak is already a little bit cold when I got it. Not good as all rating and reviews, won't come again and don't suggest my friend here also.

3LdXVnQpmTE1bgdeY45aMQ.text: I got to try a lot of cool spots when my parents came to visit for my little brother's holiday. My dad chose Flat Iron a day we were wandering about, trying to figure out how to fill our empty screaming stomachs and oh, what a good idea. I don't remember the time we walked in but we didn't wait at all and were seated on one of the little tables. I love the decoration arrangements because I'm a fan of that industrial wooden vide, but the seating was a problem in my opinion. The tables are very narrow and we're a family of tall people and large shoulders. I wasn't at ease while I kept bumping into my mother's elbows. Same applies to the seats. We were sat on stools and, to be honest, my first reaction was "seriously ?". It wasn't bad at all especially because I could lean on the wall, but stools aren't ideal when eating.There was also a little problem when we ordered cocktails to start with and they came after the food... We told them it was inconvenient and that we didn't want them anymore since we didn't get the chance to drink them. They apologized, to us to keep them and offered the cocktails. Much appreciated gesture, that was a beginner's mistake.I'm done with what I didn't like, now the food. The menu offers one choice : the steak, and a large choice of sides from healthy options to less healthy options (guess what I chose). They also have a menu of the day which included a burger that day. After the waitress highly recommended it, my brother and I got the (deliiiicious) burger and my parents got the steak. We were all very happy with our dishes and sides. We also had dessert, the one of the day and the sunday. It was nice and soothing and not as heavy as I was expected. I'll go back to eat that nice steak.Side note : i LOVE the knives.

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom. Vanilla syrup and chocolate sauce
Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom. Sunday
Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom

2ra6RjN23cGpJFb0S2TzRQ.text: Best steak in London with budgeted price.Free pop corn with refills.  Excellent service from the waiter.Top with a free Carmel ice cream n high quality chocolate chips.

25MDeZG3dwG5e1u6Eceoag.text: Terrible service. Letting other group of 4 that was missing someone to get the table. Same situation but refuses to let me in. My friend's like 15 minutes away from the restaurant.

KoIg60aEAKYjj64QO2kGFw.text: Well I never, had a more lovely steak for such a good price. Flatiron has lovely atmosphere beautiful good and the proseco was pretty good too. I went for the standard flatiron steak and share the chips, which where so delicious I wish I had my own. We also had the aubergine, basil and Parmesan side which was the cherry on top. Overall it was a great dinner and we hardly had to wait at all. X

QkMsKZr5Y-0u-CpKcvzlvw.text: I'm almost embarrassed it has taken me this long to get around to trying Flat Iron. It wasn't for lack of recommendation, because every steak-lover I know loves this place. Maybe it was my lack of enthusiasm for queuing...Dave A and I dropped into Flat Iron on a Friday night before we went to a show (it was Miss Saigon, separate review pending) and managed to time our arrival PERFECTLY. We went through the front doors bang on 6pm and were seated straight away. The service was excellent and our waitress was super-helpful and incredibly friendly.I was tempted by the idea of a deep fried burger, but couldn't be swayed from the Flat Iron steak - I mean really, that's what you're there for right! For sides we went with the roast aubergine and chips, as well as the peppercorn sauce.And before I even get to the steak, I NEED to talk about the aubergine. It was like a little baby lasagna and I could have eaten like ten more after the one that I (begrudgingly) shared.The steak was delicious. Tender and juicy and beautifully presented on a warm stone plate. It was kind of hard to leave the restaurant and go to the show, because after my meal all I really wanted was to sit in the warm restaurant, drink some more red wine and relax into a puddle of satisfaction.

C0PB7eEOLOodIdiKbsugHQ.text: Birthday meal at a favourite of mine. Managed to stroll straight in which is unheard of! Must have been birthday luck! Food was delicious as always. Steak done to perfection, sauces and veg were lovely and chips were crispy and moorish! The popcorn at the table is a nice touch! I never stray from the classic flat iron, it never lets me down and I can't wait until my next visit.

oNNg9eFq7W4GRJ533BhCag.text: I came here on a total whim but I can say this was my best meal in London, by far. I originally set out for Soho in search of Mexican food. I'm Texan and had been in Southeast Asia all summer so I was dying for it. I got a little lost and couldn't find the original restaurant I had in mind so I turned to yelp for the closest affordable restaurant and it pointed me to Flat Iron. Boy, I'm sure glad I went. I came on a late Saturday afternoon and the place was quite busy, but I was seated immediately. The interior is dim with exposed brick walls so it feels like you're in a foundry... a very chic foundry. Very cool.The menu is incredibly short- the only main listed was the £10 steak but when my server came by, he said that they're also serving a £10 burger special. I went for the steak and ordered chips on the side. I also ordered a Strawberry and Basil Collins and it was phenomenal- crisp and refreshing. I noticed their cocktail list is incredibly affordable with all of them being between £5-7 each. My food came out within 10-15 minutes of ordering. I had low expectations for such a cheap steak with what is normally a chewy cut of meat. But this £10 steak totally blew me away. I've had my fair share of beef- ranging from cheap and tough to obscenely expensive cuts of meat. This is one of the cheapest steaks I've had but it was also one of the most tender. I would have preferred more seasoning besides salt, but I do appreciate that they let the natural flavor of the steak show through. Juicy, buttery, and so so tender. And for £10!! Maybe because I came without reading the hype, it had no expectations to live up to but this steak was absolutely great. The chips too were perfectly crispy and tasty but they paled in comparison to the stunning steak. My server was incredibly friendly and attentive- always made sure I was satisfied and didn't have any questions. I appreciate the free popcorn and carafe of still water- a nice refreshment! The great service, chic ambiance, and amazing food has made this my best (and most affordable!) meal in London so far.

oGNoKDEuOcG2qwmY_5ortg.text: Best cheapest steak I ever ate in my life! The burger my partner had was also so awesome. Had a little bit of caramel taste with the burger and it was just great. Sides like spinach and the chips was also very pleasant. Ambience is also great! Might have to wait awhile to get your table.

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom. The medium rare steak! Super Yums

E2QN3RMnoHpQKlsePJ7a4Q.text: Pre theatre dinner on a rainy London night. We dropped into this smallish (bordering on a little cramped) and busy eatery and were quickly seated without a reservation (not sure if they take them). Clientele were a mix of locals and tourists. We got our drinks order in pretty quickly and prices were reasonable. I had the French Merlot which was quite good. The menu is simple - beef in the form of steaks or burgers from what I could see. It was a little dark down the back and the menus small font was making life tricky. So flat iron steak ordered and some sides to accompany. We did have to wait a bit for the mains but not too bad. When they arrived the steak was perfectly cooked and tender, the fries delicious, the side salad ok but slightly difficult to eat out of the enamel mug, and the greens of the day good. And all very reasonably priced. Service was ok, our waiter seemed to have disappeared and it took a little too long to flag someone down to get the bill.  Worth the visit for a meal but unlikely to be a regular spot for me.

qgvxOzqgmrV2uc66-r_ulg.text: After hearing all this "10 pound steak" news for Flat Iron, I was pretty excited to give it a try. A friend and I came here at around 5:15 pm on a weekday and it wasn't crowded at all. We were seated immediately and given a bucket of popcorn to munch on as we looked over the menu. I was already slightly disappointed by the popcorn because it tasted too buttery and heavy and I couldn't endure more than a couple pieces. Nevertheless I was still stoked for the steak.I ordered the steak (surprise surprise), cooked medium rare. It came out pretty quickly and I have to admit the plating was pretty cool. But upon the first bite I was awfully disappointed. The steak was definitely NOT medium rare - it was medium, possibly even medium well for some pieces (yes, different pieces on the same plate were cooked to different states...). As a result, most of the meat was terribly difficult to chew. There were also quite a few salt chunks on the pieces of steak, which I thought was pretty weird. More than a couple times I would have a piece and be overwhelmed by an excessive salt concentration. Most pieces were fairly seasoned, though, and I will say that the taste was generally satisfactory.Overall, I was not impressed by this place. After hearing all the rave reviews I was definitely expecting better. Even the low price doesn't justify coming here, in my opinion. I'd much rather pay more and have a better quality steak.

4c4buzYMyrOQhNQZRH9aSw.text: LOVE, LOVE LOVE THIS PLACE! We went to the Denmark St location because it's apparently not as packed as their Beak St location, and I love it (do I need to say 'love' one more time?)Beautiful decor, lovely staff, and the food was phenomenal. For the prices, you get the juiciest piece of steak and amazing sides to go with it. We got the spinach and aubergine... both are must-haves. The dessert was not as good so I suggest you go only for the savoury choices.

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom

GF42FhJBABPZeSFw_OpoYA.text: Great place for steak but not for those who want a complete meat feast. The size is good for the price (it's only a tenner!) but I felt that it was a bit too salty for my liking. The sides were okay but the chips were disappointing and soggy. You also have to go there and put your name down first to wait in line. Also, if you find that another friend wants to join during that wait...it's a no no...unless you go super off peak times; so personally it wasn't worth it but I guess I've ticked that box!

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom

31hcbwIVOv0NNCGCoOdDXQ.text: So I finally managed to get here after all the recommendations. I decided to come after the lunch rush as there always seems to be a queue.Arrived to be greeted and seated straight away. Really friendly and they explained the whole concept as it was my first time. Great meat, cooked simple with simple sides to accompany it.I decided to go for the special of the day, wagyu beef and side of fries. As part of the welcome they reiterate its good meat cooked just right and advise not to go over a medium rare. I happily obliged as that is also my preference.Food came out and look good, until I cut into it. The cut was completely over cooked and there was no one around for me to grab, point out and ask them to do another. If the whole concept is about simple cooking, how could they get it so wrong. What topped it off was the fries. The top half was fresh and crispy but the bottom half stone cold and soggy. It was like they had just topped up an old batch of fries that had been sitting there. After waiting a while to speak to someone I ended up just eating, waiting again, paying and leaving. (Visit - 06/07/2015 Lunch)

uzrT-4cINpjVnRgU4AC8WQ.text: Amazing steak at an affordable price - not an easy combination to find.  Cut was from the shoulder.  Steak was perfectly cooked.  Medium-Rare. Juice. Tender.  Béarnaise sauce was very flavorable but not over powering.  Drippings Cooked Chips (French fries) very flavorful without adding anything.  House Lime & Fresh Mint Frizz was very refreshing.Nice touch with a complimentary cup full of fresh popcorn.Highly recommend this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom. Flat Iron Steak - Denmark Street - Opened last July.
Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom. The Flat Iron Steak, house leaf salad, bearnaise sauce, Dripping Cooked Chips (French fries), House Lime & Fresh Mint Frizz.

7lrSFL8f-XZxeYyXctvnpw.text: A steak, as good as it gets for this price, with crunchy fries and lovely service.The new Flat Iron restaurant in Denmark Street is the second branch I have visited and just as beautiful as their first restaurant in Beak Street. If you have ever been to the Beak Street branch, you will immediately recognise that this is a Flat Iron restaurant, although they do not yet have a sign outside - they just opened about a week ago.When I visited, the special of the day was An onglet steak, and as I never had an onglet at Flat Iron before, I decide to give it a try. It came as beautifully presented as their signature flat iron steak with the same delicious salad. Which is a remarkable thing to say for me, but I do actually like their salad, probably mainly because of the dressing. I ordered my steak with chips and once again I was very happy with that choice. The thin-cut chips are golden and crispy and all around delicious. As far as I remember, I had the Macabeo white wine before and I still quite like it. The fresh and dry white kind of works even with a steak.For dessert, I took advantage of the seasonal offer: strawberries. Overall, another excellent meal at Flat Iron. Not only is the food tasty and good-value, but the staff are also really nice and friendly. No question, I will be back soon to check out the other dessert...

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom

jeFcvZ_2qOi3eGqcqvaiCg.text: Fantastic steak with the finishing salt is perfect. Also the chips were pretty decent as well. A little odd to sit so close to a different party but it was fair enough for the space available.

3ZAugoUDIDAPxaikDpCDvg.text: I can't say enough good things about this restaurant.  Service was great and friendly, everyone who I spoke to was interested in what I thought about my food and what they were doing.But the star here is the food.  Namely the steak.  I had the special of the night, which was Wagyu inside skirt steak.  It came out cooked perfectly medium rare and seasoned with a good amount of salt.  One of the best cuts of meat I've eaten, and cooked with care. The fries (cooked with drippings) were awesome.  Wow wow.  You need to check this place out, you will NOT be disappointed.

fygjTvtZqQTyavNxaL2HgA.text: Yes! The 2 hours waiting time is real! At least, if you rock up on a Friday or Saturday night during standard dinner time (which you won't get a reservation for). Solution: You come by 1,5 hours before you actually wanna eat and put your name down. Then, you go to a nearby bar, wait for their "your table is ready"-text and already water your mouth for what's about to happen: Rip Eye Steak, with a side salad for 10 Pounds. You heard me. Served by absolutely top notch waiters/waitresses. We were explained where the meat comes from, what's special about it and what she can recommend as a side. I mean, let's be honest, there's not much to choose from, oh an sorry veggie-friends, but this place has absolutely nothing to offer for you, except of salad, greens and chips. No seitan or tofu steak. But that's not the point of Flat Iron anyways! They do very simplistically what they can do best - Steak! Get in there.

6vhFhdAXYPErID4BMe39yQ.text: £10 for a Flat Iron steak. To me that already shows fantastic value. But going to the newer Denmark St Flat Iron I realised that not only is their sides (creamed spinach, aubergine) an exceptional accompaniment to this beauty of a steak but they have regular daily steak specials. Often because meat is fresh in and being butchered. So I long to see their specials board.This like Burger and Lobster is a simple menu with an uncomplicated idea that has a delicious meal to match. Some good Fred Sauce too. You won't go wrong in value for money here. They know their meat. Just hope they don't open TOO many branches!

xAqW22DCrcuIgf_xwJ8trA.text: Food and service are really good!! A small salad comes with the steak. So when you choose the side dish, I suggest not choosing the salad again. Try the chips instead. It's amazing!!

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom

7Nu1ByPff7kXkOtsYcnIxA.text: First time at Flat Iron with my friend, Hosung. Incredibly good steak, crisp, light beer, and an amazing sundae. It made my night! Thanks for the great service and delicious food.

MKbNSI6QRZ6en5d36irNHA.text: Best meal I've had in London by far! Just as I was giving up hope of finding decent food here Flat Iron saves the day. I read about the long wait times so I was a little hesitant to go in the first place - got there around 10:50pm on a Friday night and had no wait - I'm assuming the long waits are during prime dinner hours. The space is small and cozy but super cute. Full of character with brick accents, candles lights illuminating the whole space, a fireplace warming the restaurant - really amazing space. Probably the greatest thing - the menu - they serve only 1 main course - great for people like me who can't decide. There may be a special or 2 of the day but their main item is the flat iron. I got mine medium with a side of market vegetables - broccoli spouts. Portion wise - it would not be Ron Swanson approved however the flavor and tenderness were amazing. One of the better steaks I've had - cooked perfectly, flavorful and buttery. The plating was super cute - on a small hotplate with utensils consisting of a small meat cleaver! The broccoli side was great as was the strawberry basil collins. Prices were very reasonable - £10 for a steak in London! And a good steak at that. Service was on point, food was great, decor was beautiful. Awesome place!

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom. The flat iron - medium - delicious!

L7ZDnQPxIXuJvAg-Us7xTQ.text: Absolutely one of the best steak places anyone could ask for. My steak was cooked to a perfect medium rare, the side dishes were all good, the dessert was great, and the service topped it all off. Prices were good too!

s0TnJ7BEuMCjmlBOeZ8MeQ.text: Flat Iron is great. They serve steak for ten British pounds and the creamed spinach and beer was everything I could have asked for.

lShLRDQvPL-c800ZV_ZbSg.text: Ok so first and foremost, yes the steak was good, not Argentinean steakhouse quality but probably up there with most steakhouses I've tried. For 10£ that's saying something. However considering everything else is add on, it's not exactly super super budget. Sides are 2.50-4£ extra. Sauce 1£ etc so you're looking at 13-15£ all included. The salad that comes with it is useless because it is wet like it has dressing on it but tastes like water. Why put it there if you're not going to put a half decent dressing on it ?? Their reservation system is efficient: you arrive and if there aren't any tables they take your name and number and send you a text when your table is ready. We only had to wait 15 minutes at 6.30pm so we just went to browse in a bookshop across the road but you can definitely go have a drink in a pub if they tell you it's longer. Side note: I hate restaurants with stools instead of chairs. I know it's to prevent you lingering but they are so uncomfortable it actually makes me want to leave or is that just me? If you're looking for a good steak and chips at a reasonable price then Flat Iron is for you!

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom

LPjmpVP_PV4xlReqt2EAIw.text: For a 10 spot, the steak and greens is great, but for a full rounded meal, an additional side is a must. The horseradish cream sauce was a nice complement to the meat. I was seated as a lone diner at a rather small table meant for 4. It was uncomfortable when halfway through my meal they sat a couple at my table. I was literally sitting as a third wheel on their date. I could tell they were uncomfortable too and even whispered to each other about possibly leaving to go someplace else. Space is limited in this tiny place, i get it, but they managed to make 3 diners uncomfortable, which is a service no-no.

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom

uFiYV_3lmwgHxx4w2Q2Gkw.text: Who doesn't love a good piece of steak? When it's at a bargain price of £10 a steak, there's even more to love.At Flat Iron, that's exactly what you'll get. When you're seated down, you're given a cup of popcorn to snack on. You might think this is odd, until you realise they've used the beef drippings to flavour the popcorn - giving Flat Iron another reason to be unique!The marbly steak was cooked exactly how I liked it - medium rare. Char-grilled yet  super tender. I had no complaints with it! It looked a little pink, but it wasn't bloody at all. You also get a really cool mini cleaver to cut your steak with! Each steak comes with a serving of their house salad, which is essentially some fresh greens with a simple dressing.You can also opt to spend an extra £1.00 and choose one of the sauces to accompany your steak. I chose the peppercorn and was not disappointed! It was creamy and peppery, but not too overpowering, so it complimented the steak really well. Seriously worth spending the £1.00!I also tried out the special item which was the burger  - simply served in a seeded bun, with shallots and a Bearnaise sauce. Don't judge a book by it's cover! Although it looked like it hadn't been put together with much care, it was definitely cooked with love. The same quality of meat as the steak, meant the burger patty was full of flavour. So overall, I had a pretty good time at Flat Iron. The steak on it's own is probably not enough to fill you. But with the sides it's a pretty pretty meal. Or if the burger is on offer, then go for that. It's a pretty cool dining experience and I'd highly recommend it. But it won't be worth it if you have to wait 2 hours, so make sure you get there early!

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom

9MhZWHxeT55jQz9yhhOAGA.text: I would have given five stars for the steak alone, because it was perfect! but I also really loved the side salad with blue cheese and nuts that I got. And their cocktails looked divine (I didn't try them though) plus the place is so nicely decorated. A perfect place if you're going to the theatre or just really crave a steak. Not super big portions, but I was really full after dinner. And reasonably priced. I am definitely going back next time i'm in London!

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom. My steak was P-E-R-F-E-C-T!
Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom. The beathroom decoration
Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom. My friend had bearnaise sauce with her steak, I had "Fred's" which was spicy tomato. Yum!

PKDAEVUIX4y1BWk4v1tD6A.text: I have to say, I think this is my favourite restaurant in London.Sister restaurant to Beak Street but with it's own unique charm.Situated about a ten minute walk from Tottenham Court Road station along the unassuming Denmark Street. Subtle signage outside will need to be looked for but once you find it, you're in for a real treat.Social seating throughout but don't let this put you off, even if you're not in to this kind of thing. Lovely decor throughout. Sitting anywhere, you'll have a nice time but I prefer sitting at the back.Typically famed for it's Flat Iron steak (no surprise here). If you're not familiar it's a skirt steak, cooked only one way, rare. Not the best cut of meat you'll ever find but, honestly, one of the best you'll ever eat. Cooked and seasoned to perfection. Presented on a wooden chopping board, sliced relatively thinly. Served with a small side salad but treat yourself to a couple of sides. Chips are thin and cooked well. I would recommend the creamed spinach but they're all very good.I, up until very recently, have always had the same thing here, the steak, not wanting to pass up on the opportunity. This having been said I recently had a burger from the specials board. This may have been a mistake. A handful of burgers have ever blown my mind. Disco Bistro, Burger Tom, maybe the first time I'd had a Byron and now Flat Iron. Deep fried, simply served in brioche and with bearnaise. Just amazing. How am I going to decide what to have in the future now! (It'll be the steak, don't worry).So, I've talked about how good the food is, so what's the catch? The price? Hells no. £10. That's right, you heard me. £10 for one of the best steaks you'll ever have in one of the nicest restaurant in town. Amazing. Treat yourself to the French Malbec and this will be one of the best meals you've ever had.I've rarely had to queue at this venue (Beak Street is almost impossible to get into these days) but if you do have to wait. WAIT, you'll not be sorry. Pop your name on the waiting list and go and find one of the amazing bars in the area until you're called in!I love this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom

wjCSxsnE6mw9WFaGG2c2zA.text: What can I say that hasn't been repeated already. This place is heaven for a meat lover like me. Been here twice. First time I had the onglet special, which was amazing. Last time I had just the standard cut and it was just as delicious. It's a good thing it's not too close to home or work, otherwise I'd be there every night :DThe sides are simple but also very good. Altogether makes a healthy meal if you skip chips and go for greens (kale, for example). However, I found it rather hard to resist the salted caramel ice cream dessert both times, so there goes my healthy meal. Ah well, no regrets! The service is excellent, too. All waiters and waitresses are very friendly. The first time the lady who explained me everything even sat down with me on my table, made for a more comfortable and amiable conversation, I enjoyed that. Good recommendations based on my preferences and no pressure on ordering anything in particular.About the queues... I went there twice on my own for dinner rather late (around 9) and was seated straightaway (I was lucky, I suppose, although last Friday it was just rather empty). I attempted to go with a friend on a Thursday and there was a queue of 1,5 hours, so we skipped it and went elsewhere. So it's a matter of giving it a try and if no room there's plenty other restaurants to choose from in the area.The only negative point for me is the door. People forget to close it and if it's windy it can get a little annoying. But the waiters are usually on top of this and are quick to close the door again.

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom. Irish beef belly - delicious, though chewier than the flat iron steak

lM8l8mw_riigHYP_yCrnJw.text: Delicious steak!! Amazing service (thank you, Ben!)Simple menu with perfect options.

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom

yHFko7YbCVpiq6IQE6AS4A.text: Fantastic find. Yes, you'll probably have to wait. But worth it! £10 steak is delish. I added chips (which were great) and a side of bernaise (sp?) sauce. Food came very quickly. Service was pleasant and attentive. Inside has a cool, chic vibe. A great meal in London for less than £20 with a drink? Yes please!

XOarhuRZYCtdZ9NrGJpUnQ.text: First time eating steak in London. We were looking for a place for some cheap steak. We heard flatiron is a Nice stop for some steak in. We order the standard flatiron steak for $10 pound. The potion was good for the price but I wasn't completely full after the meal. The servers were super nice. I would recommend people to try it out if they are not very hungry.  They do have a larger steak plate for share.

Bv3kwVVjEOOgr2UoHgp1dw.text: £10 is a crazily low price to charge for a steak in London.  £10 is an even crazier price to charge for a REALLY GOOD steak in London.  But, if you do one thing really, really well as Flat Iron has, you can get away with the £10 steak being the only entree on your menu.The Flat Iron steak is served up pre-sliced on a butchery board, hot from the grill and glistening in the lamplight.  I recommend nothing past medium for a perfect flavor, lovely pink color, and tenderness.  Your tenner also gets you a side salad with a mustard vinaigrette dressing.  Sprinkle on some sea salt and try it with classic béarnaise, horseradish cream, or peppercorn sauces - or try Flat Iron's tangy "Fred's Sauce" which is almost like a creamier cocktail sauce with a bit of a kick, each costs £1.  You're armed with a mini butcher's cleaver to attack your steak with, a quirky and fun way to make the mood even steak-ier.Sides include creamed spinach, bee-dripping fries, broccoli and a special asparagus when in season.  All the sides are priced between £2.50-£3.50, so I recommend sharing them around the table and just going for the whole spread!  Add them to the steak, side salad and a sauce and you're doing to be well-fed for around £16.  It bears repeating, that price is amazing in central London.I go into more details about the extras like the burger special, cocktails, and desserts on beeffanatic.com, but needless to say, this is an amazing deal for a delicious steak - so much so that you might even want two.

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom. The knives here make me smile - bring on the beef.
Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom. Still the best deal in steak in London by far.  At 10, you can get two and still be spending less than at a fancy steakhouse.
Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom. Bullish outlook from the WC's

7e7R7YS0yAvyA3xhVsdE9g.text: Bigger than their Beak Street location and a little less busy, this is my place for steak in London. However, unlike their other location, this one doesn't seem to have a bar that you can wait in. No matter, they have a really good system that texts you to let you know when your table is available so we headed to Foyles for a drink in their cafe.A short while later, the text came through, well before their 45 minute estimate. Heading back there, we were greeted at the door and shown to our table. We ordered medium rare steaks, a portion of chips, an order of aubergine parmesan, and a side of Bearnaise sauce. All were served quickly and to be honest, tasted absolutely divine. They only serve one cut of meat on a regular basis and it shows how much practice they have had doing it. The £10 cut of meat was tender, well seasoned and did not need the béarnaise (although I still used it, I love it!). Who doesn't love chips cooked in beef fat either (well, probably not the vegetarian/vegan section of the population...).Declining dessert we opted for the check, and left. Happy, sated and making a mental note to visit agin.

-I4jDAIYY1BhfuDf1R5UEw.text: They don't take reservations but they will put you in a waiting list, and text you when your table is ready. Expect a 30-40minute wait. Walk to the Craft Beer Co. and sink a few back while you wait.+ Food is primarily steaks sourced regularly from premium British suppliers, ands peculiarly cuts from the market that day/week. So options other than the central 'Flat Iron' do chance. There is not a burger permanently on the menu so don't come expecting one! One day they'll have burger, or Wagu Beef Skirt, or an 800g-1kg ribeye to share..+ Steaks are seared and placed in sous vide until steaks are cooked perfectly medium-rare (they really recommend you have it like this, but will do it to your preference). Steak comes sliced, so no need to faff about with the quirky mini-cleaver*. Served with a decent helping of house salad & dressing (lambs lettuce). - the fries, made fresh daily by a named person on the menu, are tasty but are nowhere near Honest Burger or Patty & Bun. Best grab some Fred's Sauce (a wasabi & chill-garlic blend?)- Drinks: the cocktails are meh, and the Old Fashioned wasn't impressive. Too sweet and not boozey enough by far! That said, the wine selection is solid- get the Malbec or everything French. Prefer to get some solid whiskeys to compliment the meat.+ Dessert: perfectly simple vanilla ice cream in a Sundae flute, with a pot of molten milk chocolate and a pot of molten vanilla syrup for you to pour and mix at your leisure. A great little piece of food theatre and delicious.Overall: you can eat well on £20 (steak, fries, desert) and £22 plus a glass of wine or a beer, if you fancy waiting. I have one massive bugbear, and some might think it's stupid:* The cleavers are blunt as blunt can be. Yes I know it's a safety issue, and yes I know the serving platters are rock and would blunt or chip the knives if used as a chopping cleaver. Yet it's massively disappointing when one of your big draws and PR hooks are these cleavers. Ron Swanson would not approve.

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom. Sundae!
Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom. Steak Flat Iron
Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom. Menu

knZAL4Ucv43UaXhnKTI90A.text: I don't have much to add to what's already been said. Reasonable prices, good food, great chips,  some popcorn while you wait and the potential for long waits for a table.My wife and I showed up for dinner at 6pm on a Tuesday night and had to wait 20 minutes for a table. Not bad.once we got our table it took us all of three seconds to decide what to order- steak and chips and a few sauces (bernaise and peppercorn). The food came out super fast. The presentation was beautiful. The chips are delicious, seriously some of the best I've ever had. The sauces were alright. I thought the steak was better off without them. The steak was good. Not huge. It was cooked medium rare like I requested, but I wish it had a bit more char or sear on it. But for the price, good.The restaurant was packed and there's not much space around you. It was really loud, too. Service was really good, actually.

BtWCWA67EqHxvrVJ2YU-qg.text: This was by far the best meal I had in London. We ran over to Flat Iron during the interim of the Harry Potter play. Within only a 10 minute walk of the theatre it was easily accessible. We were seated immediately at a table upstairs. It's community-style, so we were sharing a table with another couple. This is not my favorite way to dine, but with such a small place it's really necessary to get the maximum number of seats possible. The drinks were delivered quickly and we were given a pitcher of infused water to accompany the meal. The steaks were perfect. A delicious medium rare with just the right amount of mouth-watering seasoning. Combined with the mini cleaver that is supplied instead of a knife and I couldn't resist diving in. My only regret is that my time in London was limited, so I didn't get to come back for a second round.

eTK6T6ycoGYML_yS7poD3A.text: A top quality steak sits pretty highly at the top of my food appreciation list - but to get that quality, it can be pretty pricey. But thanks to Flat Iron, those of us on a budget can get our steak fix without having to eat beans on toast for the next fortnight.The bare brickwork of the walls combined with a skylight and plants gives it that European 'al fresco' feel without having to deal with, y'know, actually being outside with the weather (and pigeons).Flat Iron's menu is incredibly simple - the only main course is, as you'd expect, a steak. For £10, you can get the house steak with salad and then add sides - I went for the Dripping Chips, which are some of the most unbeatable chips I've ever had in the city. Crisp on the outside, soft on the inside - and the fact that the chef cooking the chips has their name up on the blackboard is a lovely personal touch. The steak itself is pretty much perfection on a plate (well, a chopping board, because plates aren't cool these days). Recommended served medium rare, it's incredibly tender, juicy, slightly seasoned and, most importantly, packed with mouthwatering meaty flavour. I'd also never experienced dessert at Flat Iron but as a treat, I decided to give the Salted Caramel Sundae a whirl. BEST IDEA EVER. The sundae comes with two tiny pots - one with a vanilla syrup and the other a chocolate sauce. The combination of soft, fresh dairy ice cream with the sauces works perfectly to quell the sweetest of teeth - and as you reach the bottom, a beautiful salted caramel surprise awaits.In total, I spent £28 (including a tip) on my steak, fries, Salted Caramel Sundae and a couple of glasses of wine. Usually, the only place you'd get a steak meal including drinks for under £30 is good old Spoons, so considering the epic quality of the food, it's a reasonable price. Plus, if you're REALLY stretched, the steak and salad and some tap water would only set you back a tenner (plus tip). Total bargain.

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom. Steak and Dripping Chips at Flat Iron, Denmark Street
Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom. Salted Caramel Sundae at Flat Iron, Denmark Street
Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom. Decor at Flat Iron, Denmark Street

XG76uh550eAWFVzyOGkfMg.text: Our last night in London and shopping in the Soho area. Kept seeing this place popup in searches... Now I know why!. Nice ambience, great blend of music, awesome food and cocktails! We had six items from the menu plus the old fashion. The two steaks were perfectly prepared to order and quite delicious.  Salads were fresh and perfectly dressed. Other sides were very good. Tried one of the sauces (peppercorn) it was also very good but not necessary for the steak! Nice sundae for dessert.Waiter Marco also provided excellent advice and service!Loved it! Will definitely consider next time in London.

nrfSl5LgixfBKEjRyIbgaA.text: I really wouldn't consider this a true steakhouse. Flat Iron offers one kind of steak, the flat iron cut, which is known as a very lean cut. The menu is small, basically everyone gets the flat iron steak for 11 euro. Don't get me wrong, this is super cheap for a nice portioned piece of meat that they cook very well by your request. Though the meat itself is just very tough. I couldn't swallow most of it. By no means is this going to be the best piece of steak you have but its decent for the price I suppose. I'd rather go to blacklock for Sunday roast!I wish I had tried the burger though?Burger 10 euro vs. Steak 11 euro The fries were crispy and delicious! Get them!Also got the spinach dip and a few sauces- horseradish cream and the beaurniase, bithe were ok and 1 euro each.

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom. Coolest little cleaver for 10 euro if you want to take one home.

d4JC6OFQo9D2iRc-x3vQvA.text: I went here for dinner..i ordered the flat iron steak..it taste really good...staff were friendly and helpful!!CONCLUSION = RECOMMENDED

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom. The Flat Iron Steak

PsDwCV8PN4dyTc54F4Vj1A.text: The steak was good and so was the curated old fashioned.The service was quick; but he initially put us at a table with water dripping from above, which he knew because he wasn't shocked when I told him about it.

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom

QNk4VF93OLOCS1ElQvgZ7Q.text: Lovely prime rib eye steak, creamed spinach and triple fried chips.really good quality and I noticed they do an offer at certain times on the board outside. What I like is this place doesn't offer a huge variety but what they do offer ie steak and chips are done excellently. Definitely worth a visit if in the area.

0NqKdIinCIx5plZwO7kZMw.text: Cheap steak, but good! Highly recommend when in London.Get medium rare with the horseradish sauce and the black pepper sauce, you'll thank me later. I liked that the black pepper sauce was kinda creamy. I dipped my steak in both sauces.The Fentiman's rose lemonade and the house made passionfruit fizz was also perfect. I'm not a fan of passionfruit BUT they used fresh passionfruit and for some reason, it was so unique and I loved it. The rose lemonade had a tint of rose which was also very yummy.Salad was just eh. It was complimentary, but too much dressing. Just whatever, but I guess it's included. I wish they put the dressing on the side so I can pour to my liking. Also did you see the knife?! It's suuuper cute, I wish I could've taken it home c(x

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom

aDCB5bRbjJEFNFLRgk6MlA.text: If you just want steak or a burger with good service in Theater land then this is the place to come!!

JOOJd52aqUn393vLhY6hrg.text: Be prepared to wait! My husband and I avoided the queue and put our name down for a late dinner, strolling around town in the meanwhile. When we returned, we were immediately seated in the cozy back area. Our server was fantastic, and very responsive. We each had the house steak, a side of chips, and a sauce (peppercorn for me, Bearnaise for the hubs), alongside a carafe of delicious red wine on special. The steaks were served with tiny meat cleavers instead of a knife, which was adorable and actually very functional. For dessert, we had sea salt caramel ice cream. Everything was delicious, the ambiance was great, and the service was top notch!

wa8AUkw7lxxunM4htu5QDQ.text: Oh my goodness!! A cute tiny place with a set menu!I got the burger and my husband got the steak, both foods and appetizer /sides were sooo delicious and fresh!

sgP2gcz_YMK3yUQDJ_1E-w.text: Must visit for good steak and fun vibes without breaking your bank! £10 steak with salad, medium rare, and sides to share. They have some good drinks too on the menu. The meat was cooked to perfection and super tender, I almost wanted a second order but got fries to share instead. It was thick cut and so satisfying. Service was friendly and I thought it was really sweet that they provide complimentary popcorn for you to snack on while you decide on your meal. Really great place to catch up with friends or just enjoy a delicious meal before going to the theatre or out in town.Would definitely come back next time I'm in London. They also have several locations so you can stop by one that works with your plans for the day.

xLCVg0FdU9igRmE7_iXK_g.text: The steak is really amazing, and is also very cheap($10). Recommended steak for medium rare. They are very busy during dinner time, probably wait around 30mins.

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom

4T7s5aZYjUv8I0wF2xwEzg.text: Good steak, with green leaf salad. delicious chips, crispy, flavorful. amazing sundae with chocolate vanilla and caramel!

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom

Ngldo0SG7CQl_AfhbZZ14Q.text: Delicious!    Great atmosphere and wait staff.  The menu is limited, but steak is their staple and oh man do they do it right!   Highly recommend Flat Iron!

bk2xF8zDa9Q_2DZ2MhhCHg.text: So happy that we ran into this place while in London! Our flight had gotten delayed and we landed in London late and by the time it was 11:20 we were starving and looking for good food. The menu here is simple with a £10 steak and many sides and great drinks! The meat is a decent size and so tender. They recommend it medium rare which was perfect. The strawberry and basil tom Collins was also great for 6£. The creamed spinach here is delish as they have diced spinach in the thick cream and so is the eggplant and cheese was great! Highly recommend as the service is FAST and we were out by 12pm ready to ht up Soho!

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom. All the sides
Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom. The sides: salad, creamed spinach, frites, eggplant tomato cheese dish
Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom. Strawberry Colins w basil was good

haL1_0YUjbXhgWd5U035lQ.text: We found this place online before our trip.  It was rated one of the best places to eat in London for the price point.  It did not disappoint.  My wife and I had dinner here after a long day of traveling from the US.  The staff was amazing.  We were welcomed by the staff immediately when we entered the establishment.  David, our waiter, was amazing.  Since it was our first time there he explained took the time to explain the menu to us and even provided some helpful hints for touring London.  The food was amazing and the price was excellent.  To our surprise we were provided desert to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary.  We will definitely visit again before we leave.

OVqK3oUtOYS2FeQu-wdZbg.text: This location was closer to the British Museum and I didn't want to walk to Soho. The steak is cheap but relatively small portion. It is very tender but you probably have to order a side with it. I ended up eating 2 hours later.

DuAgPgocTDOh47MgZTBMJQ.text: Awesome. This is absolutely number 1 valuable for money steak house in Zone 1 London. If you want to avoid a long que, I recommend going here between lunch and dinner time.

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom

QqiFAWLh6GyCQ_NF9kwlSA.text: The Flat Iron in Denmark Street is a quirky little restaurant that fits the area perfectly. The staff was friendly and accommodating; we felt welcome right away even though the place was quite busy. It's also relatively small, yes, but it didn't feel overcrowded in a bad way. The overall concept is great and fits together very well - from the personable staff over the interior and the surprsingly bright room, the cute butcher's cleavers instead of steak knives to the fact that they serve only one kind of steak - it all works perfectly together to make your visit fun and memorable.And the flat iron steak they serve is definitely memorable. It had a very rich meaty taste and due the way it was prepared and sereved it was also astonishingly tender. Very impressive.We had fries, beans and spinach as sides and some nice, summary Lychee & Rose Martini beers from the daily recommendations.Overall, I am very glad we stumbled into The Flat Iron  as it was just an amazing guest experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom. The star: Flat Iron Steak, medium rare with just a little sea salt
Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom. Sides: Fries, Spinach, Beans...

aWQVxf58A8Inxbhp29J8yA.text: I have been to Flat Iron a few times now, basically each time I visit London since being introduced to it I will go there for dinner one of the nights.When the restaurant is full you will need to join a virtual queue. The restaurant will text you when a table is ready and you get a link to check your spot in the queue. This could do with some refinement as the the link massively overestimates the time to wait. The guy at the door warned us this and said that the link will say that the wait time is four hours but it was actually about 90 minutes. Sure enough, about 90 minutes later we had our text and we headed back. Just something minor that could do with some adjustment. I'd also like to add that this was after 6pm on a Saturday night. Other times that I have been the wait time has only been about 20 minutes.The restaurant itself has a nice look and feel to it but it is awfully cosy. We ended up chatting to the women at the table next to us since the tables are only about 10cm apart. If you don't like talking to strangers then you should maybe reconsider but if you don't mind making a few new friends during your meal then go for it!As has been stated by others, the menu is very simple. There is one main: the Flat Iron steak. This steak is delicious, juicy and full of flavour. They also usually have a couple of specials and this time they had a burger as well as flank steak. My dining partner and I decided to have the Flat Iron steak and the flank steak and share half each and this was such a good decision as both steaks are absolutely delicious. We had our steaks with chips which are also very tasty, and I decided against sauce as the steaks are so tasty that I don't feel the need to add any more flavour.The staff are all so friendly and attentive but without being in your face. I have seen the same guy in there each time and he is always so pleasant and friendly when taking the orders that you just find yourself chatting away with him. Going from the receipt, I believe his name is Marco and he is an absolute credit to the restaurant.They seem to have also added Wi-Fi recently. Certainly this was the first time that my phone saw that there was Wi-Fi available. I get no phone signal in there so that was a nice extra touch.I would recommend this restaurant to anyone who enjoys a good steak. And at £10 a steak it is an absolute bargain. With chips, a side if you choose, and a drink, you're talking around £20 a head which is still amazing for a sit down meal in central London.

aVeZKcWvsnTuo2TrDmkb9Q.text: Cheap steak and salad for £10 need I say more?!? Also you get a cute cleaver to cut up your steak! The steak is succulent and great quality. Definitely a cheap go to place for steak on the cheap. Only issue.. the wait can be from 40 mins onwards and I don't think they take reservations. You walk in ask for a table and they put you in a online queue. They then message you when your table is ready. So if you know for sure you want to eat here you can pop in get a place in the queue and plan it out accordingly.

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Flat Iron - London, United Kingdom
